{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2= | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass= | newb1 = | newb2 = | newb3 = | newb4 = | newb5 = }} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:24, 10 September 2014 (UTC) == Internal links == After going through the links in this article looking for the disambiguation pages mentioned in the tag at the top, the only ones I found are: *[[High vacuum]] *[[Electron tube]] *[[KDKA]] *[[Arthur Berry]] Don't have time to look at them at the moment so will leave them here and will hopefully get back to them. Also, there appears to be a higher than normal number of redirect pages linked. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC)

The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:24, 10 September 2014 (UTC) == Internal links == After going through the links in this article looking for the disambiguation pages mentioned in the tag at the top, the only ones I found are: *[[High vacuum]] *[[Electron tube]] *[[KDKA]] *[[Arthur Berry]] Don't have time to look at them at the moment so will leave them here and will hopefully get back to them. I also noticed several pages linked to multiple times, most often from within the history section, as far as I am aware this is incorrect and only the first instance should be tagged. Also, there appears to be a higher than normal number of redirect pages linked. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 09:38, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :Have now removed tag template as does not seem appropriate to me. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 12:44, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::There were some left (identified with [[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]]) and I have fixed them. Most of them would have resulted in further duplicate links within the section. I fixed quite a bit of duplicates, too. CSJJ104 is right about fixing those ([[WP:REPEATLINK]]). Redirects, however, are just fine ([[WP:NOTBROKEN]]). [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:15, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :::I copied the content from about 1888 on from the German wiki, and I just linked whatever words were linked in that article, without checking where they went. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 13:27, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::::[[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]] looks like a useful tool, thanks for mentioning it Finnusertop :) [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 15:37, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ==Source dump== Do with this what you will. http://scholarlycommons.law.northwestern.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1408&context=njilb == Merge timeline == The timeline part of the History section in this article seems like it does, or will eventually be duplicated with the [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] and I am proposing that we condense the timeline content in this article, put a {{tl|main}} tag on it, and merge it into the slightly broader [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]]. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 04:00, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''': Condensing it should also mean putting it in [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 17:04, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support''' but I have some doubts about the qualtiy of the machine translation. The terminology needs to be checked line by line and then it all needs to be put into prose.--[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 19:25, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support'''. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC)

http://scholarlycommons.law.northwestern.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1408&context=njilb == Merge timeline == The timeline part of the History section in this article seems like it does, or will eventually be duplicated with the [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] and I am proposing that we condense the timeline content in this article, put a {{tl|main}} tag on it, and merge it into the slightly broader [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]]. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 17:04, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support''' but I have some doubts about the qualtiy of the machine translation. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC) ::Would it be more appropriate to '''split''' this into [[Timeline of consumer electronics]]? I feel like the timeline it taking up 80% of the article, and detracting from the overall coverage of the subject. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 01:24, 15 September 2014 (UTC)

{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:24, 10 September 2014 (UTC) == Internal links == After going through the links in this article looking for the disambiguation pages mentioned in the tag at the top, the only ones I found are: *[[High vacuum]] *[[Electron tube]] *[[KDKA]] *[[Arthur Berry]] Don't have time to look at them at the moment so will leave them here and will hopefully get back to them. I also noticed several pages linked to multiple times, most often from within the history section, as far as I am aware this is incorrect and only the first instance should be tagged. Also, there appears to be a higher than normal number of redirect pages linked. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 09:38, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :Have now removed tag template as does not seem appropriate to me. Most of them would have resulted in further duplicate links within the section. I fixed quite a bit of duplicates, too. CSJJ104 is right about fixing those ([[WP:REPEATLINK]]). Redirects, however, are just fine ([[WP:NOTBROKEN]]). http://scholarlycommons.law.northwestern.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1408&context=njilb == Merge timeline == The timeline part of the History section in this article seems like it does, or will eventually be duplicated with the [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] and I am proposing that we condense the timeline content in this article, put a {{tl|main}} tag on it, and merge it into the slightly broader [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]]. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 04:00, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''': Condensing it should also mean putting it in [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 17:04, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support''' but I have some doubts about the qualtiy of the machine translation. The terminology needs to be checked line by line and then it all needs to be put into prose.--[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 19:25, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : Support. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC) ::Would it be more appropriate to '''split''' this into [[Timeline of consumer electronics]]? I feel like the timeline it taking up 80% of the article, and detracting from the overall coverage of the subject. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 01:24, 15 September 2014 (UTC) ::*'''Support''' split. This would work out better, and would become a valid, workable [[WP:SPINOUT]] of this article. Struck the "Support" in my comment above. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 01:38, 15 September 2014 (UTC)

revision.comment: /* Merge timeline */ cmt and explain more in depth that Google "translations" are problematic even for cooking pot descriptions, let alone a technical text
revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. it into the slightly broader [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]]. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 04:00, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''': Condensing it should also mean putting it in [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 17:04, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support''' but I have some doubts about the qualtiy of the machine translation. The terminology needs to be checked line by line and then it all needs to be put into prose.--[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 19:25, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : Support. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC) ::Would it be more appropriate to '''split''' this into [[Timeline of consumer electronics]]? I feel like the timeline it taking up 80% of the article, and detracting from the overall coverage of the subject. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 01:24, 15 September 2014 (UTC) ::*'''Support''' split. This would work out better, and would become a valid, workable [[WP:SPINOUT]] of this article. Struck the "Support" in my comment above. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 01:38, 15 September 2014 (UTC) According to [[Wikipedia:Translation]] Google "translations" aka Google garble are worse than nothing. So I've commented out the machine translated part of the second section. The Google garble in the first section has been edited many times, but still, it absolutely has to be reviewed by someone who speaks German. It's a technical text. Another alternative would be to keep only the most obvious and important points and simply delete the rest. --[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 05:57, 15 September 2014 (UTC)

{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:24, 10 September 2014 (UTC) == Internal links == After going through the links in this article looking for the disambiguation pages mentioned in the tag at the top, the only ones I found are: *[[High vacuum]] *[[Electron tube]] *[[KDKA]] *[[Arthur Berry]] Don't have time to look at them at the moment so will leave them here and will hopefully get back to them. I also noticed several pages linked to multiple times, most often from within the history section, as far as I am aware this is incorrect and only the first instance should be tagged. Also, there appears to be a higher than normal number of redirect pages linked. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 09:38, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :Have now removed tag template as does not seem appropriate to me. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 12:44, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::There were some left (identified with [[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]]) and I have fixed them. Most of them would have resulted in further duplicate links within the section. I fixed quite a bit of duplicates, too. CSJJ104 is right about fixing those ([[WP:REPEATLINK]]). Redirects, however, are just fine ([[WP:NOTBROKEN]]). [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:15, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :::I copied the content from about 1888 on from the German wiki, and I just linked whatever words were linked in that article, without checking where they went. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 13:27, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::::[[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]] looks like a useful tool, thanks for mentioning it Finnusertop :) [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 15:37, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ==Source dump== Do with this what you will. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC) ::Would it be more appropriate to '''split''' this into [[Timeline of consumer electronics]]? I feel like the timeline it taking up 80% of the article, and detracting from the overall coverage of the subject. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 01:24, 15 September 2014 (UTC) ::*'''Support split'''. This would work out better, and would become a valid, workable [[WP:SPINOUT]] of this article. Struck the "Support" in my comment above. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 01:38, 15 September 2014 (UTC) According to [[Wikipedia:Translation]] Google "translations" aka Google garble are worse than nothing. So I've commented out the machine translated part of the second section. The Google garble in the first section has been edited many times, but still, it absolutely has to be reviewed by someone who speaks German. It's a technical text. Another alternative would be to keep only the most obvious and important points and simply delete the rest. Also, I will not be able to revise the whole thing in the near future. --[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 05:57, 15 September 2014 (UTC)

{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are. [[User:Nedim Ardoa|Nedim Ardoa]] ([[User talk:Nedim Ardoa|talk]]) 19:45, 14 September 2014 (UTC) ::Would it be more appropriate to '''split''' this into [[Timeline of consumer electronics]]? I feel like the timeline it taking up 80% of the article, and detracting from the overall coverage of the subject. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 01:24, 15 September 2014 (UTC) ::*'''Support split'''. This would work out better, and would become a valid, workable [[WP:SPINOUT]] of this article. Struck the "Support" in my comment above. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 01:38, 15 September 2014 (UTC) According to [[Wikipedia:Translation]] Google "translations" aka Google garble are worse than nothing. So I've commented out the machine translated part of the second section. The Google garble in the first section has been edited many times, but still, it absolutely has to be reviewed by someone who speaks German. It's a technical text. Another alternative would be to keep only the most obvious and important points and simply delete the rest. Also, I will not be able to revise the whole thing in the near future. --[[User:Melody Lavender|Melody Lavender]] ([[User talk:Melody Lavender|talk]]) 05:57, 15 September 2014 (UTC) :Yes, that was an error on my part. I really thought that the collaboration would be an exception to that rule, but the reality was it not. In hindsight it should have been translated bit by bit, so I apologize for that. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 13:57, 15 September 2014 (UTC)

revision.comment: /* Merge timeline */ Support split: But please make sure it has some sources so that it doesn't have to be nominated for deletion straight away.
revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Business & Economics|class=start|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Electronics|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{Former TAFI|date=June 10, 2013}} {{Former TAFI | date=8 September 2014 | page=Consumer electronics | oldid1=624602845 | oldid2=625581000 | oldclass=stub | oldb1 = n | oldb2 = n | oldb3 = y | oldb4 = n | oldb5 = n | newclass=start | newb1 = n | newb2 = n | newb3 = n | newb4 = y | newb5 = y}} {{Translated|de|Unterhaltungselektronik|133863065|625040995|section=History}} == ever falling prices? == i don't think, that the prices are "ever falling" there are many CE sectors, where the pricing is quite constant since many years. The number of transistors is you can get for a given price is rising and you get more perforamnce and features for the same price. --[[User:MrBurns|MrBurns]] ([[User talk:MrBurns|talk]]) 22:59, 10 October 2009 (UTC) == Brown goods == [[Brown goods]] redirects here, but what does the phrase mean? thanks [[Special:Contributions/80.179.220.87|80.179.220.87]] ([[User talk:80.179.220.87|talk]]) 10:19, 12 November 2009 (UTC) I was thinking that myself! I searched for 'brown goods' and like you got redirected with no explanation! I've since corrected the redirect to the correct explanation and expanded the term for our UK visitors. See [[Brown goods]]. --[[User:Quatermass|Quatermass]] ([[User talk:Quatermass|talk]]) 09:51, 13 October 2010 (UTC) :As of September 2014 it now redirects to [[Small appliance]]. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 12:24, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Less individual products? == Should it be mentioned that nowadays some products (such as cameras, microphones and GPS) have become less common because they are integrated in smartphones? [[User:PWNGWN|PWNGWN]] ([[User talk:PWNGWN|talk]]) 22:50, 11 May 2013 (UTC) == Merge with Electronics industry== {{closed|text= I think this a article should be merged with [[Electronics industry]], but I am unsure which direction the merge should go. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:02, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment:''' Looking purely at the semantics and [[Wikipedia:Scope|scope]] of it, they are different things; electronic industry manufactures electronics that are meant for others than consumers, too. I think the [[Electronics industry]] article is just currently out of scope and tries to back this up with the unsupported claim "electronics industry, especially meaning consumer electronics". That two stubb/start class articles on related topics happen to have almost identical contents reflects the poor initial quality of these articles, not the ultimate scope corresponding to title that we should be aiming at. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 16:03, 8 September 2014 (UTC) *Removing this merge proposal. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 03:45, 11 September 2014 (UTC) }} == Lists of consumer electronics? == How should we represent individual products or classes of products in this article? FOr examples, we could talk egenrally about personal audio devices, but the importance of the [[Walkman]] and [[iPod]] probably also warrant a mention. It would be easy to include a list of notable consumer electronics, but it might be easier to include a generic writeup and forward people to the relevant category, or a preexisting list article. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:15, 8 September 2014 (UTC) :Individual products can be used as examples to illustrate [[WP:PROSE|prose]]. Any lists would be either severely incomplete or overly exhaustive. I can't see a list of 'notable' consumer electronics being anything but irrelevant; if some item is important then it should be included in prose and with context. Eg. {{quote|"Walkman popularized the idea of a portable audio player, while the iPod connected online music retail with portable devices"}} :Instead of {{quote|"Important devices for some reson:}} :* Walkman :* iPod " :As for linking to lists, a simple link to [[:Category:Consumer electronics]] will do. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 15:39, 8 September 2014 (UTC) == Translation efforts == Melody Lavender has started translating from [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unterhaltungselektronik the German page] on consumer electronics, but there is also good content that can be grabbed from [https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot%C5%99ebn%C3%AD_elektronika Czech wiki], [https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electr%C3%B3nica_de_consumo Spanish wiki] and [https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viihde-elektroniikka Finnish wiki]. Remember that per [[Wikipedia:Translation]] we have to tag the talk page with {{tl|Translated page}} so as to preserve copyright. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 15:44, 9 September 2014 (UTC) :I'm a Finnish translator but I don't find the Finnish page particularly good. I might check it for things we may have overlooked, but in that case I'd rather dig out a proper source than go through the process of translating unsourced material. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:24, 10 September 2014 (UTC) == Internal links == After going through the links in this article looking for the disambiguation pages mentioned in the tag at the top, the only ones I found are: *[[High vacuum]] *[[Electron tube]] *[[KDKA]] *[[Arthur Berry]] Don't have time to look at them at the moment so will leave them here and will hopefully get back to them. I also noticed several pages linked to multiple times, most often from within the history section, as far as I am aware this is incorrect and only the first instance should be tagged. Also, there appears to be a higher than normal number of redirect pages linked. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 09:38, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :Have now removed tag template as does not seem appropriate to me. [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 12:44, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::There were some left (identified with [[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]]) and I have fixed them. Most of them would have resulted in further duplicate links within the section. I fixed quite a bit of duplicates, too. CSJJ104 is right about fixing those ([[WP:REPEATLINK]]). Redirects, however, are just fine ([[WP:NOTBROKEN]]). [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 13:15, 10 September 2014 (UTC) :::I copied the content from about 1888 on from the German wiki, and I just linked whatever words were linked in that article, without checking where they went. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 13:27, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ::::[[User:Anomie/linkclassifier|linkclassifier]] looks like a useful tool, thanks for mentioning it Finnusertop :) [[User:CSJJ104|CSJJ104]] ([[User talk:CSJJ104|talk]]) 15:37, 10 September 2014 (UTC) ==Source dump== Do with this what you will. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 17:04, 11 September 2014 (UTC) : '''Support''' but I have some doubts about the qualtiy of the machine translation. I don't have a problem with the use of a condensed list format in the timeline for this article, as they're easy to read and obtain a general summary from. However, I also don't oppose a conversion to prose formatting, if anyone wants to perform this. A merge to Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering is fine for the bulk of the content. It will definitely take some time and significant work to reformat content to fit the table at the merge target, though. [[User:Northamerica1000|NorthAmerica]][[User_talk:Northamerica1000|1000]] 23:11, 11 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Support''' agreed, per above. [[User:EuroCarGT|'''///Euro''''''Car''']][[User talk:EuroCarGT|'''GT''']] 02:43, 12 September 2014 (UTC) ::A look at each item in both lists reveals a few date discrepancies discrepancy, invention of the triode and invention of the iconoscope, but otherwise both lists are completely different. If it wasn't the case that one was a table and the other in text form it would be an easy merge. --[[User:NickPenguin|Nick]][[User talk:NickPenguin|Penguin]]([[Special:Contributions/NickPenguin|'''contribs''']]) 05:24, 14 September 2014 (UTC) {{Outdent|2}} '''Alternative to merge.''' We should move the material to [[Talk:Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering|the talkpage]] over at [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] instead of merging. There are three rationales for this: 1) The material is unsourced and therefor better as reference material to help editors determine how to expand that article. 2) As [[User:NickPenguin|NickPenguin]] said, the source and target articles use different forms and as such a merger would take considerable effort. 3) There is a comment from February 2014 at the talkpage of [[Timeline of electrical and electronic engineering]] suggesting that that article is already out of scope and should be split; adding more material now would be unhelpful to that end. [[User:Finnusertop|Finnusertop]] ([[User_talk:Finnusertop|talk]] | [[User:Finnusertop/guestbook|guestbook]] | [[User:Finnusertop/contributions|contribs]]) 19:07, 14 September 2014 (UTC) :'''Comment''' I am afraid the two lists don't exactly overlap each other and merging may cause loss of some information. I prefer to leave them as they are.
